net.markenwerk.utils.text.fetcher

Interface TextFetcher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBufferedTextFetcher, AbstractTextFetcher, BufferedTextFetcher

    public interface TextFetcher
    A TextFetcher can fetch the entire content of a given Readable into a fresh char[] or String or copy it into a given Appendable.

    All methods take optional parameters to specify the buffer size and to specify, whether the provided streams should be closed afterwards. This allows to write compact code like 

     {
        foo.setContent(fetcher.fetch(new FileReadable(file), true));
 }
    instead of unnecessarily verbose code like 
     {
        Readable in = new FileReadable(file);
        foo.setContent(fetcher.fetch(in));
        in.close();
 }
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

    • Method Detail

      • fetch

        char[] fetch(Readable in)
      throws TextFetchException
        Fetches the content of a given Readable into a fresh char[].

        See copy(Readable, Appendable, boolean, boolean) for the handling of missing or invalid arguments.

        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        Returns:
        A new char[], containing the content of the given Readable.
        Throws:
        TextFetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable.

      • fetch

        char[] fetch(Readable in,
             boolean close)
      throws TextFetchException
        Fetches the content of a given Readable into a fresh char[].

        See copy(Readable, Appendable, boolean, boolean) for the handling of missing or invalid arguments.

        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        close - Whether to close the given Readable, after reading from it, if the given Readable is Closeable.
        Returns:
        A new char[], containing the content of the given Readable.
        Throws:
        TextFetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable. FetchExceptions thrown while trying to close the given Readable, if requested, are ignored.

      • fetch

             TextFetchProgressListener listener)
      throws TextFetchException
        Fetches the content of a given Readable into a fresh char[].

        See copy(Readable, Appendable, boolean, boolean) for the handling of missing or invalid arguments.

        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        listener - The TextFetchProgressListener to report to.
        Returns:
        A new char[], containing the content of the given Readable.
        Throws:
        TextFetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable.

      • copy

        void copy(Readable in,
          Appendable out)
   throws TextFetchException
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        See copy(Readable, Appendable, boolean, boolean) for the handling of missing or invalid arguments.

        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        out - The Appendable to write to.
        Throws:
        TextFetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable or appending to the given Appendable.

      • copy

        void copy(Readable in,
          Appendable out,
          boolean closeIn,
          boolean closeOut)
   throws TextFetchException
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        Missing or invalid arguments are handled gracefully with the following behaviour.

        A null is given as an Readable, it is simply ignored and handled as if there was nothing to read. If closeOut is true, the given Appendable will be closed anyway

        A null is given as an Appendable, it is simply ignored, but the content of given Readable is fetched anyway. If closeIn is true, the given Readable will be closed anyway

        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        out - The Appendable to write to.
        closeIn - Whether to close the given Readable, after reading from it, if the given Readable is Closeable.
        closeOut - Whether to close the given Appendable, after appending to it, if the given Appendable is Closeable.
        Throws:
        TextFetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable or appending to the given Appendable. FetchExceptions thrown while trying to close one of the given streams, if requested, are ignored.

      • copy

        void copy(Readable in,
          Appendable out,
          TextFetchProgressListener listener)
   throws TextFetchException
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        See copy(Readable, Appendable, boolean, boolean) for the handling of missing or invalid arguments.

        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        out - The Appendable to write to.
        listener - The TextFetchProgressListener to report to.
        Throws:
        TextFetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable or appending to the given Appendable.

      • copy

        void copy(Readable in,
          Appendable out,
          TextFetchProgressListener listener,
          boolean closeIn,
          boolean closeOut)
   throws TextFetchException
        Copies the content of a given Readable into a given Appendable.

        Missing or invalid arguments are handled gracefully with the following behaviour.

        A null is given as an Readable, it is simply ignored and handled as if there was nothing to read. If closeOut is true, the given Appendable will be closed anyway

        A null is given as an Appendable, it is simply ignored, but the content of given Readable is fetched anyway. If closeIn is true, the given Readable will be closed anyway

        Parameters:
        in - The Readable to read from.
        out - The Appendable to write to.
        listener - The TextFetchProgressListener to report to.
        closeIn - Whether to close the given Readable, after reading from it, if the given Readable is Closeable.
        closeOut - Whether to close the given Appendable, after appending to it, if the given Appendable is Closeable.
        Throws:
        TextFetchException - If anything went wrong while reading from the given Readable or appending to the given Appendable. FetchExceptions thrown while trying to close one of the given streams, if requested, are ignored.
